p:
It is well established that as a secondary complication, diabetes is associated with dysfunction or damage in other organs. In this study, the activities of plasma AST, ALT, and ALP were elevated in the T2D mice than in control group mice. The elevated AST, ALT, and ALP activities indicate liver dysfunction. Earlier studies have reported that in the diabetic condition the liver function biomarkers such as ALT, AST, and ALP elevate,
9 with which our study is also in line. However, the diabetic mice administered with metformin and the methanolic extract of the C. auriculata root showed the plasma AST, ALT, and ALP activities comparable to those of control mice.
